title: 188-D
statement: D. Asteriskstime limit per test2 secondsmemory limit per test256 megabytesinputstdinoutputstdoutYou are given a numbern. Printnlines,i-th line should consist oficharacters "*". Lines' indices are 1-based.InputThe only line of input contains an integern(1 ≤n≤ 50).OutputOutput the described pattern.ExamplesInput3Output******Input6Output*********************

processed.result:
You are given a number $n$. Print $n$ lines. Each line should have $i$ asterisks ($*$). The lines should be numbered from 1 to $n$. 

For example:

If $n = 3$, the output should be:

```
***
***
***
```

If $n = 6$, the output should be:

```
*********************
```
Print a number of lines of asterisks. The number of lines is given as input. Each line should have the same number of asterisks as its line number.
